modules.description: Provides cleanup guarantees with exception safety through a finally combinator, and discards values of various primitive types using type-specific ignore functions. Operates on units, integers, floats, strings, and booleans. Used to ensure resource release after operations and to suppress unnecessary return values in imperative code.

Provides functions for string manipulation, list transformations, and optional value handling. Works with strings, lists, and option types to simplify common workflows. Used to clean and process input data in API request handlers and configuration parsers.

Ensures safe resource management and value suppression with exception-safe cleanup and type-specific ignore functions for basic data types. Supports unit, integer, float, string, and boolean operations, enabling reliable finalization of side effects. Allows imperative code to release resources or discard results without affecting control flow. Examples include closing file handles, releasing locks, or ignoring unused function returns.
